DOC.brief_summary: Atrial fibrillation is the most frequent sustained arrhythmia. Catheter ablation is a procedure that is currently used for the treatment of symptomatic atrial fibrillation patients. We have organized a multi-centric national survey of catheter ablation of atrial fibrillation in order to have a feedback on the type of procedures being performed and the overall results (freedom of atrial fibrillation) over an average follow-up of 18 months.
DOC.brief_title: A French Multi-centric Atrial Fibrillation Catheter Ablation Survey
DOC.criteria: all patients undergoing catheter ablation of atrial fibrillation or left atrial flutter patients undergoing catheter ablation of other types of arrhythmia
DOC.keyword: atrial fibrillation; catheter ablation; relapse; stroke; death
